15 - The Right Thing Is Being Done

Date: March 28, 1905 Location: St. Helena, California Source: Letter 29, 1905 Status: Previously unpublished
Context: Ellen White and her son Edson were perhaps the two who did the most to forward the Seventh-day Adventist work in the South.  Often their letters were focused on this work.
Dear children Edson and Emma,
     I have been waiting anxiously for a letter from you, my son. There have been so many accidents on the road lately, and the trains have been so long delayed that I
107
have been somewhat troubled on your account. I know that you have been sick in body and worried in mind.
